contentrichtext.text: {{In-universe|subject = Three Kingdoms|category = Three Kingdoms|date = October 2009}} {{Chinese |t=楊懷 |s=杨怀 }} {{chinese-name|[[Yang (surname)|Yang]]}} '''Yang Huai''' (died 212) was a military general under the warlord [[Liu Zhang (warlord)|Liu Zhang]] during the late [[Han Dynasty]] period of [[History of China|Chinese history]]. He was in charge of guarding Baishui Gate during [[Liu Bei's takeover of Yi Province]]. He plotted with [[Gao Pei]] to assassinate [[Liu Bei]], but the plan was exposed and they were captured and executed by Liu. ==See also== *[[List of people of the Three Kingdoms]] ==References== *''[[Zizhi Tongjian]]'', vol. [[:zh:s資治通鑑/卷066|66]]. {{DEFAULTSORT:Yang, Huai}} [[Category:212 deaths]] [[Category:Liu Zhang and associates]] [[Category:2nd-century births]] [[Category:Han Dynasty people executed by decapitation]] [[Category:People executed by the Han Dynasty by decapitation]] [[Category:3rd-century executions]] {{China-bio-stub}}
